text: in this country
louise fresco you've worked at the un's
fao headquarters in rome and have looked
at the whole world picture i believe the
statistic now in this country is what
about 10 percent of our income on
average goes to food is that the way
it's always been it's true for most
western countries actually there has
been an evolution and a very rapid
decline in the amount of money a
household spends on food and it's
interesting to to realize and i think
most people don't notice that in the
1950s the early 1950s just after the
second world war in this country
households would spend about 50 half of
their income on food today it's only 10
what does that mean that's actually it's
the success of agriculture it's the
success of production that made food
cheaper and cheaper but at the same time
it's the tragedy of that success it is
that all of us today spend so little on
food in the western world that we forget
how important it is when food is so
important that your survival depends on
it it it becomes the utmost the most
important thing in your life what has
happened to all of us today here is that
we've forgotten how important food is we
take it for granted it's everywhere we
have food if you want in this country 24
hours a day you can buy it and with that
it has lost some of its real meaning
